ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How old were you the very first time you smoked even a puff?
How much of a cigarette did you smoke the very first time you tried a cigarette?
Notes: 1 = puff only; 2 = 2 puffs 3 = 3-5 puffs; 4 = 6-10 puffs; 5 = More than 10 puffs; 6 = A whole cigarette; 7 = More than a whole cigarette; Check only one answer

ElementDescription: After you tried smoking for the first time, how soon did you try smoking again?
Notes: 1 = Never tried again; 2 = The same day; 3 = The next day; 4 = Within a week; 5 = Within a month; 6 = Within 3 months; 7 = Within 6 months; 8 = Within 1 year; 9 = More than 1 year

ElementDescription: About how old were you when you smoked your first full cigarette?
Have you smoked more than 100 cigarettes in your lifetime?
Have you ever smoked daily?
About how old were you when you FIRST started smoking every day?
How often you have smoked in the past 12 months (check one)?
Notes: 1 = Every day; 2 = Nearly every day; 3 = 3 to 4 times a week; 4 = once a week; 5 = 2 to 3 times a month; 6 = once a month; 7 = 7 to 11 times in the last year; 8 = 3 to 6 times in the last year; 9 = 1 to 2 times in the last year

ElementDescription: How often have you smoked in the 12 months prior to the last year (meaning two years ago) (check one)?
Notes: 1 = Every day; 2 = Nearly every day; 3 = 3 to 4 times a week; 4 = once a week; 5 = 2 to 3 times a month; 6 = once a month; 7 = 7 to 11 times in the last year; 8 = 3 to 6 times in the last year; 9 = 1 to 2 times in the last year

ElementDescription: In the past year, has the frequency of your smoking..
Notes: 1 = increased; 2 = decreased; 3 = stayed the same; 4 = not sure

ElementDescription: How many cigarettes do you currently smoke per day (or if you don't smoke daily, how many cigarettes do you smoke on a "smoking day")?
What brand of cigarettes do you currently smoke most of the time? A. Brand of Cigarette:
What brand of cigarettes do you currently smoke most of the time? B. Length of Cigarette (check one)
What brand of cigarettes do you currently smoke most of the time? C. Menthol? (check one)
What brand of cigarettes do you currently smoke most of the time? D. Tar content? (check one)
Do you currently use any of these other tobacco products (check all that apply)?
Notes: 1 = Cigars; 2 = Pipe tobacco; 3 = Chew; 4 = Snuff; 5 = E-Cigarette; 6 = The only tobacco product I use is cigarettes

ElementDescription: Where do you typically get your cigarettes (check one)?
Notes: 1 = Convenience store (eg., 7-11); 2 = Wholesale store (eg, B.J.S, Sam's, etc.); 3 = grocery store; 4 = package store (liquor store); 5 = tobacco shop; 6 = other type of store note listed above; 7 = from friends or family members; 8 = vending machine; 9 = other

ElementDescription: Have you intentionally quit smoking for one day or longer (check yes or no)?
During the last 12 months, how many times have you intentionally quit smoking for one day or longer?
Notes: ___Number of times I have quit smoking for one day or longer.

ElementDescription: In your lifetime, have you ever quit smoking for more than one year?
In your lifetime, have you ever quit smoking for more than one year. If YES, how many times have you quit for more than one year?
Do you think you will be smoking 5 years from now (check yes or no)?
How many people, besides yourself, smoke in your household (check one)?
Notes: 1 = nobody else; 2 = 1 other person; 3 = 2 other people; 4 = 3 other people; 5 = 4 other people; 6 = 6 or more other people

ElementDescription: In which of the following locations do you regularly smoke (check all that apply)?
Notes: 1 = Home; 2 = Work place; 3 = Car; 4 = Outside; 5 = Bar/lounge; 6 = Restaurant; 7 = Other

ElementDescription: As far as you are aware, did your mother smoke when she was pregnant with you (check one)?
As far as you are aware, did your mother smoke when you were 1-10 years old (check one)?
As far as you are aware, did your father smoke when you were 1-10 years old (check one)?
As far as you were aware, how many people (including your mother, father, siblings, aunts, uncles, grandparents, etc) smoked in your household when you were 1-10 years old (check one)?
Notes: 1 = nobody; 2 = 1 person; 3 = 2 people; 4 = 3 people; 4 = 3 people; 5 = 4 people; 6 = 5 or more people

ElementDescription: Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project (used for source IDs that change depending on timepoint/visit/etc.)
